head.supplied: Melbourne ¶ 18/7/77 ¶ The honorable Graham Berry, M. L. A., ¶ Chief Secretary. ¶ Sir...

div.p: 81/R48385, unit 915, VPRS 1207/P000 inward registered correspondence, VA 865 Department of the Treasurer, Public Record Office, Victoria.
The honorable Graham Berry, M. L. A.,

I have the honor to solicit permission, that at the Governm. Printing Office the lithographic drawings for an an
word repeated. intended industrial Atlas of the Eucalypts may be printed, if the issue of these plates with descriptive text for technologic purposes should meet with your approbation. Mr Ferres, so I learn, has the requisite means for carrying out the work.
File annotated: 'Approved G. B.'. On 27 July, M wrote on the file: 'Will the Undersecretary kindly arrange, that effect is given to this approval of the honorable the Chief Secretary. Ferd. von Mueller.' The file was referred to the Government Printer on 28 July 1877, requesting him ‘to arrange with the Government Botanist about getting the work done’. It was ‘noted &returned’ by him on 2 August, and referred back to M with the comment: 'The Government Botanist will perceive that the Govt Printer has received instructions 3 Agt 1877 W. H. Odgers'. To this, M replied: 'Returned with best thanks. Ferd von Mueller. 7/8/77'. See also M to W. Odgers, 22 August 1877 (in this edition as 77-08-22a) and M to G. Berry, December 1877

div.p: I have the honor to be,
